channel.title: Change language of XP
channel.description:
ok,
i recently got a copy of XP but in Dutch. Is there anyway of changing the language of the OS? I dont mean the language settings, i mean XP is in dutch.
Yes, i would dl another but I really am not able to from where i am, nor can i use my own disks for the same reason. Patch?
Many thanks

item.title: Change language of XP
item.dc:creator: @Zach1188 Zach1188
item.description:
@Zach1188 wrote:

What do you mean by that? XP is a name, not a word. At leaste I think.

Read full topic

but thanks

item.title: Change language of XP
item.dc:creator: @Zach1188 Zach1188
item.description:
@Zach1188 wrote:

Iâ€™m pretty sure you cannot change the language from inside Windows. If I remember correctly, there is an option while installing Windows. Try using the Windows CDs you already have, reinstall it, and see if there is a setting.

Edit: Forget what I just said^^^

First, make sure your control panel is in category view, not classic view.

Go to Start > Control panel > Date, Time, Language, and Regional Options > Regional and Language Options

You should be able to get it from there.

Read full topic
